messages.message:
Question for FE folks: I am still new to codebase and I see other apps thats are not AI Hub also sharing a component I need to touch (`IBRecordManager`). However, I do see the last time someone touched the file (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/lib/src/IBRecordManager/main.tsx) was about 18 months ago.

Do we still maintain `ml-studio` and `flow-review` apps? I am currently considering creating a copy of IBRecordManager for the single use-case in AI Hub under HR grid view (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/fa1f96379fa0012bd3e0d235a13e63e64f8450da/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/features/Review/components/DocumentGrid/index.tsx#L253C1-L254C1) as I don't see how useful it would be to maintain reusability here across legacy apps especially for newer designs/use-cases.

why do you need to create a copy of `IBRecordManager`?

to answer your question, we do not do any active development on `ml-studio` and `flow-review`, but solution engineers still need to use these apps on AI Hub environments to build advanced apps
-> so these apps still need to continue to work
should we quickly huddle on this after our team meeting?

yes we can do a huddle! Well, not an exact copy (just copy the name of the component) but more-so a fresh new V2 just for AI-Hub because the code seems to be outdated and there are some performance improvements + cleanup I was going to add to help with large documents.

> to answer your question, we do not do any active development on `ml-studio` and `flow-review`, but solution engineers still need to use these apps on AI Hub environments to build advanced apps
If that's the case, I also see the last change in `IBRecordManager` were mainly just copy changes (for the legacy apps) from 18 months ago and the actual logic was written 3-4 years ago. I feel a bit uncomfortable changing the logic of the component and I don't think it would make sense to test all the legacy apps that use it as well which was why I considered separating it out as a new component just for AIHub. It shouldn't be too bad because right now the component is used in 4 different files and 3 of them are legacy.

I actually deleted ML Studio on master entirely :sweat_smile: . @Serena do solution engineers need ML Studio apps in AIHub envs?
cc @Yash Botadra

:surprised-pikachu: :question-block: :anguished: can we revert that PR? @Xindi Xu

yes solution engineers still build advanced apps sometimes on AI Hub environments
-> so we cannot delete any product features used to build advanced apps (ML Studio, Refiner, Validations, Flow Editor, Human Review, etc)
@Yash Botadra mentioned that we can delete ML Studio because we don't allow users to train models anymore. Yash - can you confirm :thinking_face:
Yes, this was discussed with Anant and folks from SolEng + PS as well.

got it, sounds good then!

fyi `flow-review` is still sometimes used by solution engineers when creating advanced apps, so i synced with @jaden, and he'll move forward with his approach of copying `IBRecordManager` to avoid breaking changes for `flow-review`
